types.name: SimpleName
types.comment: A simple identifier, an element of compound name.

types.name: CompoundName
types.comment: A compound name. Most names in this API are compound names.

types.name: DomainName
types.comment: A domain name is the general qualifier prefix, as its uniqueness is managed.

types.name: EntityName
types.comment: An entity name is a short form of a resource name, including only the domain and entity.

types.name: ServiceName
types.comment: A service name will generally be a unique subdomain.

types.name: LocationName
types.comment: A location name is not yet defined, but will be a dotted name like everything else.

types.name: ActionName
types.comment: An action (operation) name.

types.name: ResourceName
types.comment: A shorthand for a YRN with no service or location. The 'tail' of a YRN, just the domain:entity. Note that the EntityName part is optional, that is, a domain name followed by a colon is valid resource name.

types.name: YRN
types.comment: A full Yahoo Resource name (YRN).

types.name: YBase64
types.comment: The Y-specific URL-safe Base64 variant.

types.name: YEncoded
types.comment: YEncoded includes ybase64 chars, as well as = and %. This can represent a User credential and URL-encoded values.

types.name: AuthorityName
types.comment: Used as the prefix in a signed assertion. This uniquely identifies a signing authority.

types.name: SignedToken
types.comment: i.e. "user" A signed assertion if identity. i.e. the User credential value. This token will only make sense to the authority that generated it, so it is beneficial to have something in the value that is cheaply recognized to quickly reject if it belongs to another authority. In addition to the YEncoded set our token includes ; to separate components and , to separate roles and : for IPv6 addresses

types.name: Domain
types.comment: A domain is an independent partition of users, roles, and resources. Its name represents the definition of a namespace; the only way a new namespace can be created, from the top, is by creating Domains. Administration of a domain is governed by the parent domain (using reverse-DNS namespaces). The top level domains are governed by the special "sys.auth" domain. The org (Organization) is optional, but would refer to another domain.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the common name to be referred to, the symbolic id. It is immutable

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the last modification timestamp of any object or attribute in this domain

fields.name: id
fields.comment: unique identifier of the domain. generated on create, never reused

fields.name: description
fields.comment: description of the domain

fields.name: org
fields.comment: a reference to an Organization. Athenz doesn't use it, but it provides external hook (i.e. org:media)

fields.name: enabled
fields.comment: Future use only, currently not used

fields.name: auditEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not domain modifications should be logged for SOX+Auditing. If true, the auditRef parameter must be supplied(not empty) for any API defining it.

fields.name: account
fields.comment: associated cloud (i.e. aws) account id

types.name: RoleList
types.comment: The representation for an enumeration of roles in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of role names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next role list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

types.name: RoleAuditLog
types.comment: An audit log entry for role membership change.

fields.name: member
fields.comment: name of the role member

fields.name: admin
fields.comment: name of the principal executing the change

fields.name: created
fields.comment: timestamp of the entry

fields.name: action
fields.comment: log action - either add or delete

fields.name: auditRef
fields.comment: audit reference string for the change as supplied by admin

types.name: Role
types.comment: The representation for a Role with set of members.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp of the role

fields.name: members
fields.comment: an explicit list of members. Might be empty or null, if trust is set

fields.name: trust
fields.comment: a trusted domain to delegate membership decisions to

fields.name: auditLog
fields.comment: an audit log for role membership changes

types.name: Roles
types.comment: The representation for a list of roles with full details

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of role objects

types.name: Membership
types.comment: The representation for a role membership.

fields.name: memberName
fields.comment: name of the member

fields.name: isMember
fields.comment: flag to indicate whether or the user is a member or not

fields.name: roleName
fields.comment: name of the role

types.name: DefaultAdmins
types.comment: The list of domain administrators.

fields.name: admins
fields.comment: list of domain administrators

types.name: Assertion
types.comment: A representation for the encapsulation of an action to be performed on a resource by a principal.

fields.name: role
fields.comment: the subject of the assertion - a role

fields.name: resource
fields.comment: the object of the assertion. Must be in the local namespace. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: action
fields.comment: the predicate of the assertion. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: effect
fields.comment: the effect of the assertion in the policy language

fields.name: id
fields.comment: assertion id - auto generated by server. Not required during put operations.

types.name: Policy
types.comment: The representation for a Policy with set of assertions.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the policy

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp of this policy

fields.name: assertions
fields.comment: list of defined assertions for this policy

types.name: Policies
types.comment: The representation of list of policy objects

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of policy objects

types.name: Template
types.comment: Solution Template object defined on the server

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: list of roles in the template

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies defined in this template

types.name: TemplateList
types.comment: List of template names that is the base struct for server and domain templates

fields.name: templateNames
fields.comment: list of template names

types.name: DomainTemplate
types.comment: solution template(s) to be applied to a domain

types.name: DomainTemplateList
types.comment: List of solution templates to be applied to a domain

types.name: ServerTemplateList
types.comment: List of solution templates available in the server

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of domain names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next domain list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

fields.name: description
fields.comment: a description of the domain

fields.name: org
fields.comment: a reference to an Organization. Athenz doesn't use it, but it provides external hook (i.e. org:media)

fields.name: enabled
fields.comment: Future use only, currently not used

fields.name: auditEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not domain modifications should be logged for SOX+Auditing. If true, the auditRef parameter must be supplied(not empty) for any API defining it.

fields.name: account
fields.comment: associated cloud (i.e. aws) account id

types.name: TopLevelDomain
types.comment: Top Level Domain object. The required attributes include the name of the domain and list of domain administrators.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: adminUsers
fields.comment: list of domain administrators

fields.name: templates
fields.comment: list of solution template names

types.name: SubDomain
types.comment: A Subdomain is a TopLevelDomain, except it has a parent.

fields.name: parent
fields.comment: name of the parent domain

fields.name: name
fields.comment: user id which will be the domain name

fields.name: templates
fields.comment: list of solution template names

types.name: DanglingPolicy
types.comment: A dangling policy where the assertion is referencing a role name that doesn't exist in the domain

types.name: DomainDataCheck
types.comment: Domain data object representing the results of a check operation looking for dangling roles, policies and trust relationships that are set either on tenant or provider side only

fields.name: danglingRoles
fields.comment: Names of roles not specified in any assertion. Might be empty or null if no dangling roles.

fields.name: danglingPolicies
fields.comment: Policy+role tuples where role doesnt exist. Might be empty or null if no dangling policies.

fields.name: policyCount
fields.comment: total number of policies

fields.name: assertionCount
fields.comment: total number of assertions

fields.name: roleWildCardCount
fields.comment: total number of assertions containing roles as wildcards

fields.name: providersWithoutTrust
fields.comment: Service names (domain.service) that dont contain trust role if this is a tenant domain. Might be empty or null, if not a tenant or if all providers support this tenant.

fields.name: tenantsWithoutAssumeRole
fields.comment: Names of Tenant domains that dont contain assume role assertions if this is a provider domain. Might be empty or null, if not a provider or if all tenants support use this provider.

types.name: Entity
types.comment: An entity is a name and a structured value. some entity names/prefixes are reserved (i.e. "role",  "policy", "meta", "domain", "service")

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the entity object

fields.name: value
fields.comment: value of the entity

types.name: EntityList
types.comment: The representation for an enumeration of entities in the namespace

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of entity names

types.name: PolicyList
types.comment: The representation for an enumeration of policies in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of policy names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next policy list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

types.name: PublicKeyEntry
types.comment: The representation of the public key in a service identity object.

fields.name: key
fields.comment: the public key for the service

fields.name: id
fields.comment: the key identifier (version or zone name)

types.name: ServiceIdentity
types.comment: The representation of the service identity object.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the full name of the service, i.e. "sports.storage"

fields.name: publicKeys
fields.comment: array of public keys for key rotation

fields.name: providerEndpoint
fields.comment: if present, then this service can provision tenants via this endpoint.

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the timestamp when this entry was last modified

fields.name: executable
fields.comment: the path of the executable that runs the service

fields.name: hosts
fields.comment: list of host names that this service can run on

fields.name: user
fields.comment: local (unix) user name this service can run as

fields.name: group
fields.comment: local (unix) group name this service can run as

types.name: ServiceIdentities
types.comment: The representation of list of services

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of services

types.name: ServiceIdentityList
types.comment: The representation for an enumeration of services in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of service names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next service list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

types.name: HostServices
types.comment: The representation for an enumeration of services authorized to run on a specific host.

fields.name: host
fields.comment: name of the host

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of service names authorized to run on this host

types.name: Tenancy
types.comment: A representation of tenant.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain that is to get a tenancy

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the provider service on which the tenancy is to reside

fields.name: resourceGroups
fields.comment: registered resource groups for this tenant

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain that is to get a tenancy

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the provider service on which the tenancy is to reside

fields.name: resourceGroup
fields.comment: registered resource group for this tenant

types.name: TenantRoleAction
types.comment: A representation of tenant role action.

fields.name: role
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: action
fields.comment: action value for the generated policy assertion

types.name: TenantRoles
types.comment: A representation of tenant roles to be provisioned.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the provider domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the provider service

fields.name: tenant
fields.comment: name of the tenant domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: the role/action pairs to provision

types.name: TenantResourceGroupRoles
types.comment: A representation of tenant roles for resource groups to be provisioned.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the provider domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the provider service

fields.name: tenant
fields.comment: name of the tenant domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: the role/action pairs to provision

fields.name: resourceGroup
fields.comment: tenant resource group

types.name: ProviderResourceGroupRoles
types.comment: A representation of provider roles to be provisioned.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the provider domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the provider service

fields.name: tenant
fields.comment: name of the tenant domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: the role/action pairs to provision

fields.name: resourceGroup
fields.comment: tenant resource group

types.name: Access
types.comment: Access can be checked and returned as this resource.

fields.name: granted
fields.comment: true (allowed) or false (denied)

types.name: DomainModified
types.comment: Tuple of domain-name and modification time-stamps. This object is returned when the caller has requested list of domains modified since a specific timestamp.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modified timestamp of the domain

types.name: DomainModifiedList
types.comment: A list of {domain, modified-timestamp} tuples.

fields.name: nameModList
fields.comment: list of modified domains

types.name: DomainPolicies
types.comment: We need to include the name of the domain in this struct since this data will be passed back to ZPU through ZTS so we need to sign not only the list of policies but also the corresponding domain name that the policies belong to.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies defined in this server

types.name: SignedPolicies
types.comment: A signed bulk transfer of policies. The data is signed with server's private key.

fields.name: contents
fields.comment: list of policies defined in a domain

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: signature generated based on the domain policies object

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the key used to generate the signature

types.name: DomainData
types.comment: A domain object that includes its roles, policies and services.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: account
fields.comment: associated cloud (i.e. aws) account id

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: list of roles in the domain

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies in the domain signed with ZMS private key

fields.name: services
fields.comment: list of services in the domain

fields.name: entities
fields.comment: list of entities in the domain

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp

types.name: SignedDomain
types.comment: A domain object signed with server's private key

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: domain object with its roles, policies and services

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: signature generated based on the domain object

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the key used to generate the signature

types.name: SignedDomains
types.comment: A list of signed domain objects

types.name: UserToken
types.comment: A user token generated based on user's credentials

fields.name: token
fields.comment: Signed user token identifying a specific authenticated user

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the service

fields.name: token
fields.comment: service's signed token

resources.comment: Get info for the specified domain, by name. This request only returns the configured domain attributes and not any domain objects like roles, policies or service identities. A paginated list of domains.

Enumerate domains. Can be filtered by prefix and depth, and paginated. This operation can be expensive, as it may span multiple domains. Set of metadata attributes that all domains may have and can be changed.

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment: restrict the number of results in this call

inputs.name: skip
inputs.comment: restrict the set to those after the specified "next" token returned from a previous call

inputs.name: prefix
inputs.comment: restrict to names that start with the prefix. Can include glob'ing style wildcards

inputs.name: depth
inputs.comment: restrict the depth of the name, specifying the number of '.' characters that can appear.

inputs.name: account
inputs.comment: restrict to domain names that have specified account name

inputs.name: roleMember
inputs.comment: restrict the domain names where the specified user is in a role - see roleName

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: restrict the domain names where the specified user is in this role - see roleMember

inputs.name: modifiedSince
inputs.comment: This header specifies to the server to return any domains modified since this HTTP date

resources.comment: Create a new top level domain. This is a privileged action for the "sys.auth" administrators. Create a new subdomain. The domain administrators of the {parent} domain have the privilege to create subdomains.

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: A UserDomain is the user's own top level domain in user - e.g. user.hga

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Create a new user domain. The user domain will be created in the user top level domain and the user himself will be set as the administrator for this domain. Delete the specified domain.  This is a privileged action for the "sys.auth" administrators. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain which will be the user id

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Delete the specified subdomain. Caller must have domain DELETE permissions in parent. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be deleted

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Delete the specified userdomain. Caller must have domain DELETE permissions in the domain. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the subdomain to be deleted

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Update the specified top level domain metadata. Note that entities in the domain are not affected. Caller must have UPDATE privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be deleted which will be the user id

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Update the given domain by applying the roles and policies defined in the specified solution template(s). Caller must have UPDATE privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: DomainMeta object with updated attribute values

resources.comment: Get the list of solution templates applied to a domain

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: template
inputs.comment: DomainTemplate object with solution template name(s)

resources.comment: Update the given domain by deleting the specified template from the domain template list. Cycles through the roles and policies defined in the template and deletes them. Caller must have DELETE privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Carry out data check operation for the specified domain.
Put an entity into the domain. Get a entity from a domain.

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: entity
inputs.comment: Entity object to be added to the domain

resources.comment: open for all authenticated users to read Delete the entity from the domain. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).
Enumerate entities provisioned in this domain.

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Enumerate roles provisioned in this domain. Get the list of all roles in a domain with optional flag whether or not include members

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment: restrict the number of results in this call

inputs.name: skip
inputs.comment: restrict the set to those after the specified "next" token returned from a previous call

resources.comment: Get the specified role in the domain.

inputs.comment: return list of members in the role

resources.comment: Create/update the specified role.

inputs.comment: name of the role to be retrieved

inputs.name: auditLog

inputs.name: expand
inputs.comment: expand delegated trust roles and return trusted members

resources.comment: Delete the specified role. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of the role to be added/updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: role

resources.comment: Get the membership status for a specified user in a role.

resources.comment: Add the specified user to the role's member list.

resources.comment: Delete the specified role membership. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.comment: name of the user to be added as a member

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: membership
inputs.comment: Membership object (must contain role/member names as specified in the URI)

resources.comment: Verify and, if necessary, fix domain roles and policies to make sure the given set of users have administrative access to the domain. This request is only restricted to "sys.auth" domain administrators and can be used when the domain administrators incorrectly have blocked their own access to their domains.

inputs.name: memberName
inputs.comment: name of the user to be removed as a member

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: list of roles to be added/updated for the provider

resources.comment: Delete the configured set of roles for the provider and resource group

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Check access for the specified operation on the specified resource for the currently authenticated user. This is the slow centralized access for control-plane purposes. Use distributed mechanisms for decentralized (data-plane) access by fetching signed policies and role tokens for users. If the authenticated user has READ access to the {domain}:access resource, then he/she can carry out access checks for any other user in the domain by specifying the optional checkPrincipal query parameter.

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion, i.e. UPDATE or READ

inputs.name: resource
inputs.comment: the resource to check access against, i.e. "yrn:sports::weather:table.zipcodes" or "media.news:articles"

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, it specifies an alternate domain for cross-domain trust relation

inputs.name: checkPrincipal
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, carry out the access check for this principal

resources.comment: Return list of resources that the given principal has access to. Even though the principal is marked as optional, it must be specified unless the caller has authorization from sys.auth domain to check access for all user principals.

inputs.name: principal
inputs.comment: specifies principal to query the resource list for

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion

resources.comment: Retrieve the list of modified domains since the specified timestamp. The server will return the list of all modified domains and the latest modification timestamp as the value of the ETag header. The client will need to use this value during its next call to request the changes since the previous request. When metaonly set to true, dont add roles, policies or services, dont sign

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: filter the domain list only to the specified name

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any domains modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.comment: Return a user/principal token for the specified specified authenticated user. Typical authenticated users with their native credentials are not allowed to update their domain data. They must first obtain a UserToken and then use that token for authentication and authorization of their update requests. CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) support to allow Provider Services to obtain AuthorizedService Tokens on behalf of Tenant administrators

inputs.name: serviceNames
inputs.comment: comma separated list of on-behalf-of service names

resources.comment: A service principal object identifying a given service.

inputs.name: serviceNames
inputs.comment: comma separated list of on-behalf-of service names

resources.comment: Return a ServicePrincipal object if the serviceToken is valid. This request provides a simple operation that an external application can execute to validate a service token.
Get the list of solution templates defined in the server Get solution template details. Includes the roles and policies that will be automatically provisioned when the template is applied to a domain
